intro: Aquilegia cymosa, commonly known as the slender bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that come in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features compound leaves with lobed segments. Its flowers bloom in early spring, often before the leaves fully emerge, and are pollinated by bees and other insects. Aquilegia cymosa thrives in woodland or shaded areas and prefers moist, well-drained soil.
